discussion.p: Table 28 — "Allocator requirements" says that X::is_always_equal has a default value of is_empty<X>, and this is consistent with the return type description:

blockquote.p: Identical to or derived from true_type or false_type

discussion.p:
is_empty<X> is guaranteed to be derived from either true_type or false_type. So far so good.
/p10 says:

blockquote.p: Type: Alloc::is_always_equal if the qualified-id Alloc::is_always_equal is valid and denotes a type (14.8.2); otherwise is_empty<Alloc>::type.

discussion.p:
This is subtly different than what Table 28 says is the default: is_empty<Alloc>::type is not is_empty<Alloc>, but is rather one of true_type or false_type.
There are two ways to fix this:

li.p:
Change Table 28 to say: is_empty<X>::type.
or

blockquote.p: Type: Alloc::is_always_equal if the qualified-id Alloc::is_always_equal is valid and denotes a type (14.8.2); otherwise is_empty<Alloc>::type.

discussion.p: Both options are correct, and I see no reason to prefer one fix over the other. But Table 28 and /p10 should be consistent with one another.
